Posts.Content: Daisydoo38 l’ll give it a try. Waking every hour and a half in the night it’s so uncomfortable ️
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I lost a tun of hair even with the cold cap on my first session, went quite thin on top. I decided not to bother again and to be honest haven’t lost that much more since. I was also very anxious about it but dealing with the side effects is enough to cope with so stopped worrying about my hair. I still have a fringe so look ok in a beanie and have a great wig just in case.  I spent hours thinking and googling about cold cap and hair loss it was a relief to ‘let it go’  hope the ear gets better too.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Anyone has chemo rash? I am covered on my chest and back. Been 4 weeks now. Had various potions but now really bad and can’t sleep it’s so itchy. I start steroids for Docetaxel tomorrow and hope they may calm it down. Any advise appreciated
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hope everyone is managing to enjoy some aspects of Christmas i managed to get an infection after my first Docetaxel ( already had 3xEC) just been released after 6 days in hospital. Not the Christmas I planned but made the most of the good moments.  Home now trying to build up my strength as next chemo due  Wednesday . Even when it’s bad I remember that this will one day be a memory and there is a good life to live ahead of me sending good wishes to you all Helen
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: @tigermum I also had my first Docetaxel yesterday . No nausea yippee!! Suffered terribly on EC. I don’t start injections until tomorrow so one more day of respite. So far much kinder than EC but I hear it can take up to 5 days to kick in. Every good day is a blessing. I shopped too taday - great minds think alike. Good luck tonight
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Devon Dumpling I found mine slightly different each time, probably got a little easier each time. ( not much) head aches first time only, constipation second and third horrid rash. It’s an adventure . Hope it’s kind to you
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hello all back again till the end of Jan, 3 x EC completed, horrid chemo rash plus all the usual rubbish side effects. Docetaxel next - ekk  stick with ladies we will make it to the end xx
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: I was very sick with EC now take Akynzeo an hour before chemo and it really helps. Good to know it’s that causing the constipation- movical like you say starting the day before.  It’s all a learning game and the advice on here is always worth taking.
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: At my hospital they fit a Picc line as standard before chemo. It’s been a god send. Takes a couple of weeks to really settle and get used to but no issues with bloods or chemo. I have just been in hospital with an infection. They wouldn’t  touch the Picc ( chemo team only) so had a cannula and bloods taken. They struggled to find good veins and can only use one arm as surgery was on the other side. Cannula had to be replaced 3 times as veins started to swell - no fun at all Picc is the way to go
Posts.Title: ***December 2018 Breast Cancer Chemo Chat ***

Posts.Content: Hair feels so important before you start treatment and now I don’t give it a second thought. Have a wig ready in case you want to wear it. My children are older but liked my first ever short hair cut ( surprising so do I). I now don’t care about being bald and as I am relaxed about it so are my girls. They do ask me to pop on a hat if theirs friends come over and I’m fine with that.  Great that work are supporting -  once treatment starts it gets and you have plan it gets easier to cope this site is a saviour when in need x
Posts.Title: How to cope

Posts.Content: Hair feels so important before you start treatment and now I don’t give it a second thought. Have a wig ready in case you want to wear it. My children are older but liked my first ever short hair cut ( surprising so do I). I now don’t care about being bald and as I am relaxed about it so are my girls. They do ask me to pop on a hat if theirs friends come over and I’m fine with that.  Great that work are supporting -  once treatment starts it gets and you have plan it gets easier to cope this site is a saviour when in need x
Posts.Title: How to cope

Posts.Content: Maybe start with some more controlled like Pilates. i had a mastectomy and implant in August and was back at Pilates within 6 weeks. Just listen to your body when stretching.  Zumba is pretty full on - l’m still not keep on jumping about. Hope that helps
Posts.Title: Exercising after treatment

Posts.Content: Hi I have 2 more weeks to wait for my oncotype results. I am back at work and everything feels almost normal again. I had a mastectomy 5 weeks ago with immediate implant.  I know when I get my results it will be a whirlwind of decisions again. The forum is such a great support.  What did you decide in the end Pickles?
Posts.Title: Oncotype dx test unclear as what i should do next :(

Posts.Content: Sorry you are feeling worried. I waited about 9 weeks between surgery and the start of chemo. A similar situation waiting for initial results, more tests and then for an oncotype. The hospital wrren’t at all concerned with the delay and having all the information before treatment is so important.  I was never expecting to have chemo until the onco score came back at 37. At least I know I really needed the chemo - you don’t want to go through that unless there are benefits.  The whole process is full of anxiety and waiting is always the worst . Wishing you and you mum all the best
Posts.Title: Worried Sick Delay in starting Chemo

Posts.Content: Hi please don’t think you have upset me - just defending my surgeon who has been fantastic. It’s tricky explaining things in words sometimes. Sounds like I’m not the first person in this situation with implants and there is a good solution. Sleep tight x
Posts.Title: Symmetrising surgery to healthy breast with NA implant

Posts.Content: Hi The new implant is a good size for me (I’m 5’8” )and I am very happy with my surgeon, balancing surgery was always planned. I was a b cup pre surgery but think I have shrunk and the existing breast was always that bit smaller. Also implants sit much higher so look fuller. ( my surgeon warned me about this too)  I’m using chicken fillets ( my new best friend) just seem lots of posts about people having breast reductions to match but not the other way round.
Posts.Title: Symmetrising surgery to healthy breast with NA implant

Posts.Content: I had a mastectomy on 5th August with immediate implant reconstruction. I am healing really well although now extremely tearful adjusting to the new me. I am very small busted and my new implant is a good C cup leaving my healthy A cup breast looking lost in any kind of bra. I will contact the BCN to discuss getting some sort of prosthesis to help me for now but has anyone had symmetrising surgery using an implant to make a healthy breast larger. The suggestion is a lift and implant to try and match them up.  I am still waiting to find out if I need chemo so my emotional state is shakey  to say the least. I will receive my oncotype results next Monday - it will have been a 7 week wait!  If no chemo hoping to have the symmatrising surgery sooner rather than later  so I can begin to feel more like me again.  Any advice greatly received
Posts.Title: Symmetrising surgery to healthy breast with NA implant

Posts.Content: Thank you so much for posting and enjoy that bra shopping!! It’s such an adjustment, just having one implant just feels so weird. ‘Even’sounds like a great result thank you x
Posts.Title: Symmetrising surgery to healthy breast with NA implant

Posts.Content: I took TEVA for 2 months and now been changed to Wockhart for the last week. No difference but obviously early days for me
Posts.Title: TEVA Tamoxifen DISCONTINUED!!!!

Posts.Content: They only do an oncotype if there are no nodes affected- and micro are classed as negative  Hoping for a low score for you
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: Thanks Sharon  different information from different doctors, sites and areas!  - doesn’t make it easy for us  x
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: Hi Yes, upgraded after surgery and confirmed with oncotype Just had my second chemo today so waiting for the delightful SE’s to kick in. It’s horrid but doable - the joys xx
Posts.Title: micrometastasis

Posts.Content: I started tamoxifen on Friday 20mg and no side effects at all yet. I was ready for the worst after everything chemo managed to throw at me but so far ......... I would talk to your BCN for advice
Posts.Title: Tamoxibollocks
